Description: Sets the name of the server as it appears in the server browser
Sets the text displayed in the server's info box
If enabled, the server will show on the server browser
Sets the server language
Sets the password to join the server
Sets the number of players allowed to join the server at one time
Sets the level difficulty. 0 = easiest, 100 = hellish

Sets a comma-separated list of mission types for the server. If multiple are selected the server randomly chooses one (PvP Game Mode can only run Combat). Select from Salvage, Monster, Cargo, Beacon, Nest, Mineral, Combat, AbandonedOutpost, Escort, Pirate, ScanAlienRuins, ClearAlienRuins, All
Sets the submarine that will be used in a round. If empty, the server alphabetically picks the first submarine
Sets how the next submarine should be chosen. Manual = only a client with the SelectSub permission can select. Random = submarine is randomly picked. Vote = all players can vote
Sets a comma-separated list of submarines to be hidden from selection/purchase
Sets the respawn shuttle that will be used in a round. If empty, the server alphabetically picks the first shuttle
Sets the default game mode, which will apply unless changed via the method set under "Game Mode Selection Method"
Sets how the game mode can be changed. Manual = only a client with the SelectMode permission can select. Random = game mode is randomised. Vote = all players can vote
If enabled, players will be able to use voice chat
If enabled, the server will automatically start a round if enough players are ready, based on the "Minimum Player Ready Ratio". Otherwise, the round must be manually started
Sets the minimum ratio of players required to be ready for a round to be automatically started, if "Start When Ready" is set
If enabled, dead players can spectate. Otherwise, they are sent into the lobby
Sets the amount of time a player must be AFK to be auto-kicked
Sets the amount of time a player must be disconnected from their body for the character to be killed
If enabled, the server will generate a new seed each round

Download mods by workshop item ID under the Updates menu. Load them by editing config_player.xml in accordance with [these instructions](https://discourse.cubecoders.com/t/barotrauma-guide/3952#h-2-mods-4)
If enabled, the server will send missing files to clients (currently only .sub files). Otherwise, if a client is missing required files they cannot spawn and will be sent back into the lobby
If enabled, clients will be able to download required mods from the server. Otherwise they will need to obtain the mods themselves
Sets the timeout that applies to voting
Sets the characters approved for use in a client name. Enter as UTF-16 character code ranges. More information can be found [here](https://barotraumagame.com/wiki/Serversettings.xml)
If enabled, server logs will be saved in the ServerLogs folder upon server shutdown
Sets the number of lines generated in a log file before it is rotated
Sets the tickrate of the server
If set, UPnP will be enabled on the server. Requires a UPnP-enabled router to function
Sets the server play style displayed in the server browser and lobby
If enabled, players can vote to end the round
Sets the minimum proportion of round end votes required to end a round (if Round End Vote is enabled)
If enabled, respawning of dead players will be allowed. Otherwise, dead players will have to spectate until the round ends
Sets the time between each respawn wave
Sets the minimum proportion of dead/spectating players required for the respawn timer to start
Sets the percentage of a player's skill level that is lost on death

If enabled, respawning players may spawn in a shuttle away from the main submarine and must dock or otherwise merge with the crew. Otherwise, players are spawned in the submarine on certain job spawnpoints, depending on their job
Sets the maximum time the respawn shuttle has to dock to the submarine. If time runs out before the shuttle docks it will automatically return to the first outpost
Sets the line of sight (LOS) effect mode
Sets whether enemies' health status is shown, via health bars above their heads
Sets the percentage probability that a traitor will be on board
Sets the severity of damage a traitor’s work is likely to cause during a round
Sets the minimum number of players required for a traitor to be picked
Sets the minimum required percentage of players who must vote in favour to successfully accuse a traitor
Sets how much money players are allowed to request from the bank. 0 = money requests disabled
Sets where looted money should be sent
If enabled, players can ragdoll on their own if they hold the button down. Otherwise, players must be stunned (or be dead) to ragdoll
Sets the number of bots that should be spawned in a round. This is limited by the "Maximum Bot Count"
Sets the maximum number of allowed bots in a round
Sets how bots should be spawned. Normal = bots fill the amount of slots set in "Bot Count". Fill = bots skip that value and fully fill empty player slots
If set, bot conversations will not be allowed
If enabled, friendly fire between players will be allowed (they can deal damage to each other)
If enabled, outpost NPCs will be able to be killed
If enabled, outposts will be destructible (able to take damage)
If set, the ability to disconnect or change any default wires in a submarine will be disabled
If enabled, players can rewire anything except if it has been set otherwise in the submarine
If enabled, WiFi components on the submarine can be linked to chat
If enabled, players can disguise themselves by using another player's ID card. Otherwise, players will always have their names above them even when covering their face
If enabled, players can vote to kick others players
Sets the minimum proportion of votes required to vote-kick a player (if Vote Kicking is enabled)
Sets the minimum time period that must pass before a player can be vote-kicked after joining
Sets the ban duration for players who are vote-kicked
Sets the maximum ban time that can be set in the lobby host UI
If enabled, players will be auto-banned after exceeding the maximum password retries set under "Maximum Password Retries"
Sets the maximum number of failed password attempts before a player is auto-banned. Requires "Enable Failed Password Ban" to be set
If set, the server will automatically kick players who are causing the server to perform poorly
The server will automatically kick players who are sending more than the set amount of network packets per minute. 1200 or less = disabled
If set, the [Karma system](https://barotraumagame.com/wiki/Karma) will be enabled
Sets the karma rules preset that should be used. Requires Karma to be enabled

If set, the [LuaCsForBarotrauma modification](https://evilfactory.github.io/LuaCsForBarotrauma/) will be installed when the server is updated, providing Lua and C# modding support. Update the server after changing this setting
